instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
fn main() { let maybe = Some(String::from("hi")); match maybe { Some(val) => println!("{}", val), None => {} } println!("{:?}", maybe); }
```

## Compiler Error:
borrow of moved value in match: match on reference instead

## Fixed Code:
output: fn main() { let maybe = Some(String::from("hi")); match &maybe { Some(val) => println!("{}", val), None => {} } println!("{:?}", maybe); }

instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
fn main() { let item = Some(String::from("hi")); match item { Some(x) => println!("{}", x), None => {} } println!("{:?}", item); }
```

## Compiler Error:
borrow of moved value in match: match on reference instead

## Fixed Code:
output: fn main() { let item = Some(String::from("hi")); match &item { Some(x) => println!("{}", x), None => {} } println!("{:?}", item); }
